previous: Historic architecture has been well preserved in the Wide and Narrow lanes.

The Wide and Narrow Lanes (Kuan Xiangzi and Zhai Xiangzi) were first built during the Qing dynasty for Manchu soldiers. The lanes remained residential until 2003 when the local government turned the area into a mixed-use strip of restaurants, teahouses, bars, avant-garde galleries, and residential houses.
doc.after: Nearby Wuhou Shrine, Jinli is a popular commercial and dining area resembling the style of traditional architecture of western Sichuan. "Jinli" (é¦é) is the name of an old street in Chengdu dating from the Han dynasty and means "making perfection more perfect".
